images.copyright: Portrait Monument of women's suffrage pioneers, Capitol Rotunda, Washington, DC (© Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg/Getty Images)
images.title: Women's History Month begins
images.caption: Women's History Month
images.desc: For the first day of Women's History Month, we've come to the Capitol Rotunda in Washington, DC, to view the Portrait Monument, which depicts three founding mothers of the 19th-century women's rights movement. Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Lucretia Mott, and Susan B. Anthony are particularly known for their efforts to gain American women the right to vote.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
tooltips.walls: Download this image. Use of this image is restricted to wallpaper only.
